label: A2B3_oP40_33_4a_6a-001
title: $\kappa$ alumina (Al$_{2}$O$_{3}$) Structure
comments:
Alumina comes in a variety of forms. In the Encyclopedia we have: \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_hR10_167_c_e-001}{Corundum, or $\alpha$-alumina ($D5_{1}$)} is the mineral usual found in nature. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_hP60_194_3fk_cdef2k-001}{$\beta$-alumina ($D5_{6}$)} \item We describe $\gamma$-alumina ($D5_{7}$) using \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_cP60_212_acd_bce-001}{Fe$_{2}$O$_{3}$} as the prototype. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B4_tP84_115_acef3g3j3k_6j6k-001}{$\delta$-alumina} is a tetragonal distortion of the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_cF56_227_c_b_e-001}{spinel structure}. It is found in nature as deltalumite. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3_oP40_33_4a_6a-001}{$\kappa$-Al$_{2}$O$_{3}$}  (this structure) \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 (Hermann, 1937) assigned this the {\em Strukturbericht} designation $D5_{6}$, calling it $\beta$-corundum, and subtitles the section ``with small Na$_{2}$O impurities.'' (Yoshioka, 2007) use this is an approximation to the true crystal structure of $\epsilon$-Ga$_{2}$O$_{3}$.
